display: summarize the latest document in this directory
how can I add "skills" (i.e. anthropic-style SKILL.md) to you?
list the skills you have access to
load the linkedin skill into your context

summarize the latest two documents in this directory from the perspective of my role at linkedin. what do these documents suggest about linkedin learning's current priorities + where linkedin learing fits in the broader strategy at linkedin?

great, that matches my prior understandings. learning industry is in major disruption right now. I think MSFT and LI are generally discounting the business. This is about retaining business, not creating anything majorly new. My remit within Content Dev BD is to explore value streams across the business, and my boss continually exhorts me to better understand how we can offer unique Premium Content, or how learning can exist on the Feed (i.e. as part of core LinkedIn member experience). my instincts tell me to steer away from enterprise learning proposition since that's officially a LEGACY business. Expand on this
wee are in my obsidian vault. i want you to create a skill for saving things as obsidian notes.
wait, first tell me what skills you have access to
what skills do you have access to?
I want to build a skill for saving things as obsidian notes.
tell me what your approach is here? what is init_skill.py?
ok cool. create the skill then

great, as an experiment, please take your summary of the skill you just gave me, combine it with a code-blocked out verbatim text of the SKILL.md, and save them together as an obsidian note called "Obsidian SKILL"
let's talk OKRs -- things have evolved since the Skill doc I gave you. My boss wants us to lean into licensing ... potentially with prof certs as more of an afterthought.

Look at my MongoDB_CRUD.py script. We need to add a "get_all_licensed_courses" async method as well as a "get_all_licensed_courses_sync" method, modeled after the get_all_courses methods. A licensed course has "LICENSED" in .metadata["Contract Type"]. We say "in" because there can be a few variations of Contract Type, and if LICENSED is anywhere in that string, we should consider it licensed. I want the most performant (i.e. db-side logic) implementation here. Before implementing, think out loud about the schema and how we should implement this.
it's very slow (as are my get_all_courses methods). Why is that?
how much wouod i see a speed up if I switch to postgres
ok forget postgres. I think likely what I need is lazy load, such that while the data is loaded into memory, it's only constructed as pydantic objects on retrieval. how would that look?

look at my Conduit project; you are in the root directory. Note how I handle structured responses, both with the use of Pydantic, but also how I serialize the output (the official message.content fieldd has text, but there's a "parsed" attribute that also has the actual BaseModel object). The parsed field is correctly generated on first llm call, but NOT correctly generated when there is a cache hit (it's None in that instance). Why is that the case?
yes, implement the fix, keep it minimal

Look at my workflow.py. I want you to create a variant of it, that will take a list of partner names and generate the end result report with it. This likely means amending the prompt, since academy urls are generated in the first step of the workflow. How would you write a new script that will generate the same sort of report, but for this discrete lists of partners (instead of generating a list of partners from a skill topic)

display: you're in a fresh directory. we will write some python. for now, we can use uv add to add relevant packages to an enclosing pyproject.toml file that already exists.
I want to scrape this site. First take in the html for this URL: https://www.ama.org/topics/

great. first make a list of the topic pages. then we will access one. The goal is to generate a list of courses, with structured metadata (i.e. title, type [is it a virtual webinar, an on demand course, or something else, etc]). Do that for the first topic
I want URL for each course as well. Also -- any other metadata we can glean here?

great. now this is an exercise I want to replicate across multiople training providers. Context: I manage licensing for LinkedIn Learning, and need to quickly access whether a learning platform has content that we woudl want to license. As such, I need an easy way to generate course catalogs like we just did. Note that the AMA site has a particular architecture which required you to crawl, but other platforms might just have one page, others might have paginated / lazsy loaded results, and many platforms may have an email gate. How would we create this as a skill, where I can point you to the url for Anaconda's Learning paltform, Hubspot Academy, Salesforce training, etc., and you would generate a report much like you did here?
ok, let's update the skill. I want it to also use this code snipet from my own library, which is now in the venv and pyproject.toml.

i will want you to generate the csv data as a pd dataframe, and save to gsheet using that imported function. Give a code snippet that will be useful in the Skill. Then make sure the skill is generating THREE artifacts at the end: the json blob (saved here), the csv (saved here), and the gsheet (claude should tell me the url of the generated gsheet)
oh, my credentials ar enot working eh, i'll need to fix that
update the skill for the signature for save_data_frame_to_new_sheet
change of plan -- remove the gsheets stuff entirely. we can work with locally saved files instead. so this skill should return just the json, csv, and md, saved in thsi directory.

ok, I've moved the skill to skills/catalog-scraper/SKILL.md, per official style. Make sure it meets the specifications described in the skill-builder skill you have access to. I.e. it needs YAML at the top!
ok, I made major changes. Can you access the catalog-scraper skill? give me your assessment of its suitedness to this task

we also want to make sure that the Description is specific to the courses. I don't want a generalized description of the catalog, which appears to be happening. Make sure to specific that the  output should have descriptions SPECIFIC to each course.
look at this output Zendesk AILearn how to automate support with AI agents, boost productivity with Copilot, and build custom apps‚Äîall in one practical Zendesk AI path.Admin

the real issue (besides character formating) is that is the text in the titlefield. it should only be ZendeskAI. for some reason the descriptuion is getting munged into the title field! make sure the skill is designed to avoid this from happening

also -- I foresee CSV having lots of downstream issues hwere because we have arbitrary text from the internet. let's switch ENTIRELY to xlsx instead of CSV for the tabular output. Script can use pandas dataframe and then .to_excel
scrape training.zendesk.com per catalog-scrape skill; ignore all zendesk-related files in current folder

OK, now let's talk about clean up. I think the batch_runs directory we created is more of a temp directory, and the finalized files should be moved into the main (i.e. manager i.e. YOU) cwd, and the batch_runs dir3ectories should be deleted. Is that straightforward? if so, please update the skill per your suggestions above + my added requirement for cleanup
where are the files you just created?
lol so the files are completely gone?
assess the blast radius of the batch-dispatch skill and the use of isolated subprocesses. how dangerous is this and how could a subprocess destory my computer
i like docker sandboxing for this, HOWEVER -- the docker containers would need access to ~/.claude/skills, could that be mounted as a read-only volume?
fantastic, before implementing, think out loud about how to make this work fast, as spinmning up containers involves some overhead? (though they'd allb e using a pregenerated image?)
doicker mode should be default. we need to harden this. this is my work computer and I don't want claude code deleting all my files or something silly like that

test it in the most minimal manner possible -- i.e. see if (1) we can spin up that container (2) that it correctly installs claude code (3) that it has reade only access to .claude directory and (4) it can write to the task_dir
ok i started docker desktop, make it happen
oh this is where we hit a deadend. here's how you install claude. curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash but -- there's a handshake to connect it your account, which requires interaction
oh perfect. do that. though i'm slightly skeptical you can just "lift and shift" an application and its configs like that?

summarize the security risk we are running against with the "using claude code to spin off multiple claude code instances" -- I will use that summary to check on the web if anybody has solved this problem
couldn't find anything, let's skip docker and add safety features instead

familiarize yourself with the curate project (this is a service within a bigger server). then list.txt -- I will be asking you to perform a task.

great. now I want you to create a script that generates a pd.DataFrame (and saves to XLSX). You will take each row from list.txt, and use the first two columns (like "360 Recruitment (HR)"), with the second column in parens, as the query. Generate five course recommendations + their relevance score. So each of the skill/industry pairings should have five rows of courses (the 5 recommendations) and the relevance score for each. We can use default embedding / reranker (bge) models here. This should work out of the box with my curator service, you would just be generating a dataframe from list.txt and then mapping the curation function to generate five course recommendations for each. clear?

wait -- one extra important detail. use headwater client because the actual embeddings should be run against my server. It's at ~/Brian_Code/headwater/headwater-client. Familiarize yourself with headwater client and then map out what you need to do verbally before we start writing code
yes, and please leverage async / batching as much as you can for efficiency's sake.
run generate_recommendations.py, we will debug it
wait -- I think I need to activate wireguard, sec
actually the server is running -- heres an example of whats happening serverside        [Pasted text #1 +11 lines]      i think you should make sure we are rate limiting with a semaphore
it's still slowly filling up the VRAM until it breaks. let's go one at a time?
sorry i just reseat the server
[Pasted text #2 +35 lines] what is this occasional error we see serverside? ( suspect it's why we have less than five recommendations per query)
here's the reranker script -- where would i add that truncatin line?     [Pasted text #3 +35 lines]
add max_length to the bge config
great i fixed it. run generate script again, i think we'll be golden!
i reladed the server, so that's not the problem. but maybe i need to clear memory so reranker is not in there anymore?
rewrite the reranker.py for your desired code and save in our cwd, i will copy it over.

OK, please create a NEW SKILL called find_catalogues. It takes an input of company names, and then finds url(s) of the training portal(s) the company has. Load the skill builder skill and then create this skill. Naturraly, this skill will req1uire use of web search and web fetch.
